text:
ome hypoxic during uterine contractions.
o When oxygen deprivation occurs temporarily during labour contractions, this mechanism may cause
repetitive slowing of the heart rate (decelerations).
o Because it takes some time after the end of the contraction for oxygen to reach the baby again, in a
more compromised baby, recovery of the heart rate after the end of the contraction takes more than 30
seconds (a ‘late’ deceleration).
• Decelerations can also be due to
